hero.content:
Comparing Vaccines

Comparing vaccine candidates that the Philippine government is planning to procure

primary.title: Dissecting Data: How COVID-19 vaccine access is revealing truth about global pecking order
primary.description: The Philippines will only get access to COVID-19 vaccines by the second quarter of 2021, or mid 2022, depending on who you are asking. The government isn’t to blame. At least not the Philippine government. The governments of developed countries however are a different story. Based on the latest data, some rich nations have bought up enough doses to cover their entire population 5 times.

secondary.title: Vaccines Are Coming but They Won’t End Covid-19 Anytime Soon

carousel.title: Biden names Fil-Am to White House press office
carousel.description: OG: Perez served as a press assistant on the Biden-Harris transition team, and as national communications assistant and communications intern for the Biden-Harris campaign.
